snippet: If President Rafael Correa’s party wins a majority in the National Assembly, critics fear it will only allow him to concentrate power.
abstract: Ecuador's Pres Rafael Correa is running for re-election and holds hefty lead in polls, but his opponents fear legislative majority and new four-year term will feed what they see as Correa’s authoritarian tendencies.

byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN and MAGGY AYALA
byline.contributor: William Neuman reported from Caracas, Venezuela, and Maggy Ayala from Quito, Ecuador.

lead_paragraph: If President Rafael Correa’s party wins a majority in the National Assembly, critics fear it will only allow him to concentrate power.

headline.seo: Ecuadoreans Are Apprehensive Over Likely Re-election of President Correa
headline.main: Ecuador’s President Shows Confidence About Re-election, Too Much for Some
headline.print_headline: Ecuador’s President Shows Confidence About Re-election, Too Much for Some

keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
